HIV Carriers on Steady Increase in S. Korea
articles.content:
HIV Carriers on Steady Increase in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- HIV carriers are now on the steady increase in south Korea, according to the MBC of south Korea.
 According to the results of the survey, 317 more HIV carriers were reported as of the end of June last.    
 This is a five percent increase over that in the same period of last year, the MBC added.

articles.title: One More Assault by U.S. Soldier against S. Koreans Reported
articles.content:
One More Assault by U.S. Soldier against S. Koreans Reported 
    Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- One more case of assault committed by a soldier belonging to the U.S. 8th Army in south Korea against civilians there was disclosed on July 16, according to MBC of south Korea.
 That day the U.S. soldier beat and choked the owner and two employees of gay quarters in Puphyong District of Inchon when they did not allow him to enter there.

DPRK Delegation Leaves for Six-Party Talks
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Six-Party Talks
    Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA)--A DPRK delegation led by Kim Kye Gwan, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, left here Friday to participate in the six-party talks for settling the nuclear issue between the DPRK and the United States to open in Beijing on July 26.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and Andrei Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK

Greetings to Egyptian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Egyptian President
    Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Mohamed Hosni Mubarak, president of Egypt, on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of the July 23 revolution, the national holiday of the Egyptian people. 
 Expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to expand in the future, too, the message sincerely wished him and the Egyptian people greater successes in their work for prosperity of the country, Arab unity and peace in the Middle East.

Greetings to Prime Minister of Mauritius
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Mauritius
    Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to Ahmed Shaheed on his appointment as foreign minister of Maldives.
 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished him a success in his new job.

articles.title: Greetings to Maldivian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Maldivian Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Navin Chandra Ramgoolam on his appointment as prime minister of Mauritius as the result of the recent general election. 
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and develop in the future, the message sincerely wished him great success in the fulfillment of his new duty for social and economic development and prosperity of the country.
